website_summaries.verdict: Successfully pits large, medium, or small cherries. Comfortable to use for long periods.
pros: Includes detachable splatter shield to prevent juice from making a mess
Good materials used in build quality
cons: Takes some hand strength to use successfully

website_summaries.verdict: This combination cherry and olive pitter is comfortable to hold and use and certainly gets the job done.
pros: Product has a splatter guard, eliminating the need for hefty cleanup
Comfortable to use as movement of the mechanism is smooth
Long, metal punch in pitter increases the success rate compared to other models
cons: Splash guard doesn’t block everything, so don’t use while wearing a white shirt

customer_reviews.title: This works well with GREEN OLIVES!!
customer_reviews.text: I was really, really worried if this pitter would work with Castelvetrano olives (Ficacci). There is only one customer question about this and nobody knowing the olives replied... This review is for people like me who want to use this item as an *olive* pitter. It requires a little bit of strong grip when the olive is firm, but it still works well. The picture is the outcome and you can see some pits came out with fleshes. I think it would be much easier with soft black olives. For scale, the olive pick (upper part of the picture) is similar to common toothpicks. I hope this review will be helpful to olive lovers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's the pits!
customer_reviews.text: This cerry/olive pitter worked great. It removed the pits from cherries with minimal effort and did not destroy the cherries. I wanted to love it, but after using it four separate times it fell apart! The plastic hinge broke into pieces and the spring fell out of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Hands Which Have Hard Time Gripping
customer_reviews.text: Okay, OXO did it again! First of all a little caveat. I'm a retired chef who teaches culinary arts to high school level students at a Technical Skills Center. Second, I have a wife who has severe rheumatoid arthritis. I bought this primarily for her but know if/when needed, I'm taking this to work because it is so comfortable to use. I have been a converted OXO user for many years now. Many of the smaller tools in my life bag are OXO brand. I've also stocked several restaurants I have had a hand in opening with OXO tools, they work as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work well with larger green olives.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had read the Q&A before buying this. It just can't handle larger "Queen" sized olives. If you're going to make tapenade maybe you don't care, but if you want your olives looking nice as part of a dinner presentation or for a martini, this isn't the tool. As others have noted, you need to use so much force that the olive is just mashed along the edge of the "cup." The pitter is mostly plastic and feels like it's going to fall apart in your hands while you're squeezing. We usually like OXO products as they are of higher than average quality, but this isn't a good tool for olives. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: VA2NC

customer_reviews.title: Not for smaller sour cherries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking, “oxo, that’s a good brand; this will work.” To be honest, it probably works great for larger sweet cherries and olives but it’s AWFUL for small sour cherries. The pitter doesn’t go down far enough through the cherry so the pit stays attached, I had to pick each and every pit out out by hand... a colossal waste of time. So if you’re pitting smaller cherries or olives don’t get this one, go for a different pitter. My grandmother’s 50+ year old antique cherry pitter works better than this contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Elli

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This is tedious to use and essentially does not work. The cherry seed gets stuck in the hole, actually jammed in there, and you have to use a screwdriver or some other implement to push it out. Removing the seeds from of a bowl of cherries could turn into an all night project. Good in concept, falls well short in function.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Bad design, pits get stuck
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed that OXO has designed a cherry pitter with a hole that is too small for the cherry pits to go through! i have found all of my other OXO products purchased over the years to be great with 5 star form and fuctionality which is why I'm so shocked that they have failed in such a fundamentally necessary design feature here. I'd say about a good 1 out of 4 cherries the pit gets stuck in the hole its supposed to be going through requiring me to dislodge the pit with my hands and make things a very messy job. Not using any crazy mega cherries here either, just supermarket cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B England

customer_reviews.title: It simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Does not get the pits out. After trying about a dozen cherries, I gave up. It punches a hole through the cherry, but the pit stays inside. Threw the device in the trash. I’ve always been so impressed with Oxo products, but this one is a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust, verify you got the pit
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, but needs some more thought. You cannot trust this device to work. You MUST verify the pits are removed. PROCEED WITH CAUTION. I'd say about 50% of the time the cherry pit gets stuck in the device channel. This prevents the next cherry's pit to not be ejected. So what happens is you see the hole in the cherry you just punched, and you think you got the pit out, but you didn't. You will find yourself initially biting into a cherry feeling confident because you think it's out. Then Ouch. Dental work needed. There's got to be a better method or tool.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Pitt gets stuck too much & juice still splatters everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this pitter, but the cheap one we picked up at Aldis a few years ago was so much better. The seed gets stuck 95% of the time, and maybe it’s just me, but the juice splattered much more with this pitter. I’m sad I can’t find another one like we had. I usually love all of OXO items, but this one (in my opinion) is not one I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RAP2008

customer_reviews.title: I have lost count!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase many cherry/olive pitters over the years. Most work reasonably well and I use them carefully, taking care to place the fruit in the hopper so the pit is pushed out with the smallest profile through the system. But sooner or later I begin to use them and the part that pushes the seed out has broken off. Cleanly! No jamming! This one is fine but they all share one feature--the plunger is made of zinc! It breaks off cleanly. This one works fine but I fully expect it will fail like all the others I have buried. The plunger is made of zinc.
customer_reviews.author: ROY-MICHEL B.

customer_reviews.title: Big let-down.
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this product is good. In reality it's faster and easier to simply chew the pit out of the olive. Olives of any decent size don't fit in the tool. You lose half of the smaller olives in the pitting process. Basically, you are just generating something that now needs to be washed when you use this. Very messy, too.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as sturdy as I would have liked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove pits from green castelvetrano olives. 1 in 5 pits is too large to fit through the hole but I can live with that. What bothers me is that it doesn't feel as study as I would have liked. A couple weeks and a few dozen olives later and it has a some wiggle to it. I think the build quality would last a lifetime if you were using it only for cherries, but if you're searching for an olive pitter (and you love olives as much as I do) I predict that it will last a year or so. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Pitter
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for myself and found it extremely easy to use in pitting cherries. My granddaughter (3 yrs) really likes to eat cherries also. Her mother found her one morning sitting on the floor eating cherries and spitting the pits out, as described by her mother, it looked like a murder scene. So I ordered one and had it shipped to my daughter. Once it arrived it was immediately put to work. This is a quality product and is as easy as stated in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Jane G

customer_reviews.title: Oh Cherry Pitter, Where Have You Been All My Life?
customer_reviews.text: This is not like the infamous banana slicer. This product actually fulfills a need, one I didn't realize I needed filled until my 3 year old became obsessed with cherries. Sure you can just pop the pit out with the back of a knife, but it's a pain in the butt when you have to pit piles of cherries at a time. And it creates a major mess, with the potential of making some very bad stains. The pitter is super efficient; it pits quickly, and contains the spray back from the cherry juice. This is a great kitchen gadget if you eat cherries even slightly frequently.
customer_reviews.author: SJU82

customer_reviews.title: Yep...Time to plant more cherry trees..
customer_reviews.text: Where have you been my whole life? Seriously. Pros: *Pretty easy to figure out *Fits pretty big cherries *Less waste due to eating more cherries and not letting them go bad *Less waste compared to using knife to cut around pit Cons: * The only tricky part is removing "stuck" pits...just unscrew the clear plastic splatter thing and push out * Some cherry juice can splatter out of the bottom...don't wear fancy clothes
customer_reviews.author: A mom with a honest review...

customer_reviews.title: worked great, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make jam after cherry picking, worked great, great quality, saved a lot of time, will use for olives too!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to squeeze and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the product, given its high reviews. Cons: seeds are often too large to push through the hole, it takes a lot of pressure to squeeze and sometimes pinch your hand getting behind the squeeze, and 30% of the time, the seed isn’t removed. Pros: compact, locks in closed position Conclusion: After purchasing 5 different stoners, while it is larger to store (but it does store flat), I much prefer the Ordekcity Cherry Pitter Tool Cherry Remover
customer_reviews.author: Technically

customer_reviews.title: Great once I figured out which direction to insert the cherry
customer_reviews.text: I found that if I put the cherry stem-side out then I was only getting the pit out about half the time. However, by switching it to stem-side in (facing toward the hinge) the pit comes out the first time 80-90% of the time. Once I figured that out it was smooth sailing, and now I don't have to worry about my kid choking on a cherry pit or waste a bunch of times cutting them in half.
customer_reviews.author: R. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Choice: Sturdy, Comfortable, & Healthier Than Lye-Pitted
customer_reviews.text: Since olives are pitted commercially with lye (the corrosive in Drano), it's healthier to pit them ourselves, and this tool is great for pitting cherries too. I buy Trader Joe tubs of mixed olives in brine some are too small to stay in this cavity to pit, but those are easy to eat & spit the pit; and this works great for standard to large size olives. After having to return a similar cherry/olive pitter but it had a rubber central ring that promptly tore, this sturdier version is worth slight more price I expect it to last a long time. This gives me confidence in Amazon Choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lady LiberTEA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made product. The splatter shield is helpful but I also held the pitter in a shallow bowl and I wore an apron and spread a clean dish towel on the counter to protect it from any cherry stains. At first I thought it was hard to use but after a few cherries I got the hang of it. I made a 12" fruit crisp in a cast iron fry pan and it was delicious. Yes it takes a while to pit all the cherries but worth the work. A few pits got stuck but the handle of a spoon quickly dislodged them from the pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Book Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to use and effective. Didn’t crush the cherries either. There was only one really large cherry in my bunch that would not fit in the pitter. Even with the splatter shield, there was still a little bit of cherry juice splatter I had to clean up, but the shield helped. I would recommend pitting into a bowl in the sink to avoid staining anything. Have not tried this on olives yet.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super simple, easy to clean, and works so well it's just fun and satisfying to use. I found myself forcing my girlfriend to eat all the cherries I pitted but couldn't actually eat myself because I just got carried away it's so easy, just line it up and squeeze the handle. POP, POP, POP, POP, POP In less than 2 minutes, I can have 3 pounds of cherries ready to eat. Just pop them in my mouth, YUM!
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great value.
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter definitely gets the job done. It feels sturdy and as if it will last a while. The only complaint I have is that it's a little harder to squeeze than the old one I had. It requires a little more hand strength and might be difficult for someone with arthritis. But, considering the old one is discontinued and retails on ebay for $30 and this one was only $12, it's not a problem for me. I just readjust the cherry in the pitter and it eventually hits the right spot and goes through.
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Priceless tool for those who like cherries!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased 10 lbs. of bing cherries to soak in bourbon. This tool was absolutely priceless and helped me work through all 10 lbs. in one afternoon. I did not rush too much, but it would have taken multiple days without a tool like this. The quality is great, and it is well engineered. The hole in the cherry was not significant enough to make me feel like i was losing too much cherry. My hand was not sore at the end of the 10 lbs. I highly recommend this to anyone working with cherries in any amount.
customer_reviews.author: wagsaww

customer_reviews.title: pits still in cherries
customer_reviews.text: 4 out of 20 cherries still had pits in after putting them through this device one at a time to remove the pits with this device. In addition, two pits got stuck in the device. Flipping the device upside down and tapping on a surface cleared the pit from the device. alternative? Already broke one tooth on cherry pits and then the device kind of works 14 out of 20 times.
customer_reviews.author: Snapples

customer_reviews.title: OXO - They simply are the best
customer_reviews.text: Another satisfied customer for this OXO Cherry/Olive pitter. First of all-it's solid construction, lightweight and easy to use. Second-it excels at the job of getting those pesky pits out of my cherries; Third-so easy to clean. If a pit gets stuck, just remove the little guard which is easy, clear the path and reattach. All in all another OXO WINNER!
customer_reviews.author: B. C. PoppeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Pit pusher is too short & hole too small
customer_reviews.text: Usually OXO is a good brand but this will likely hit the trash can when I find a replacement. The pin doesn't go through the hole and the hole is too small. Pits get jammed in the hole and you find yourself with red fingers trying to clear it more than half the time. I just did 3 and 2 of them jammed. Do engineers ever actually use the stuff they design? And if not WHY NOT!
customer_reviews.author: Chet

customer_reviews.title: Pits get stuck
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to LOVE this product. As a mom who loves cherries and has a toddler this was going to be my savior. The first couple cherries it worked really well. Then the pits started getting stuck and not fully coming out of the Cherry. I then had to use a knife to get the pit out of the mechanism. Maybe these cherry pits were just bigger but I wish the opening was a little bit bigger
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Large Cherries don't Fit!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed - I have 2 lbs of Bing cherries that were to go on top of a goat cheese tart I planned on making today. No such luck, the cherries are way too large for the pitter so that leaves me with having to figure out how to remove the pit from 2lbs of cherries and that's a lot of cherries. OXO seldom disappoints but this is a definite miss.
customer_reviews.author: Baazumi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; Easy on Arthritic Hands
customer_reviews.text: I just finished pitting two pounds of cherries in prep for making preserves. Prior to purchasing this pitter, I had always used the old-fashioned kind with the two finger holds. What a difference this device is! Because it is an OXO product, the handles are designed for persons with grip issues. The pitter shoots the stones into a dish and then the fruit can easily be placed into a dish or the user can turn the device to the side and let the fruit fall into the dish.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Madden

customer_reviews.title: OK for big cherries.
customer_reviews.text: My old cast iron hand crank cherry pitter from my grandmother works better for my cherry tree cherries, but not for huge store bought bing cherries. This one worked better on the larger fruit. About 10% of the large fruit pits would not punch through. Still able to get the pit out and clear the tool. Ok for about a pie worth of cherries. If I were putting up more fruit I would find a better tool. Comfortable to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Smokeydog

customer_reviews.title: effective at a good price
customer_reviews.text: good little pitter -- won't really work on larger cherries (like Rainier) or huge olives, but good for the normal, slightly smaller ones; easy to clean, use, and sleek overall quite happy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Why Didn't I Buy This Sooner??
customer_reviews.text: Things I wish I had bought years ago... I used to pit cherries by slicing them in half with a knife. What an idiot I've been!! This is so easy and less messy! Just put the cherry in the tool and clamp it closed and out pops the pit. So easy! You can do a bunch very quickly and then just need a quick rinse in hot water to clean it off.
customer_reviews.author: NernFX

customer_reviews.title: Easy and less messy
customer_reviews.text: Like everything about this cherry pitter. It’s so easy to use and is a lot less messy that removing pits by hands. Update: before adding my cherries to my pie I decided to double check them for stray pits and found several left behind. They had been pushed to the side instead of out. Beware of this and just double check your cherries or olives.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Works PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean and it works. You might want to wear your kitchen apron because well you're punching a hole in the cherry and there is cherry juice inside a cherry that might splatter you. Simply set the cherry on the pitter, squeeze the handle and the cherry gets "spit" out the bottom. I just use my sink with a strainer n the drain to contain any splatter that happens when you have delicious juicy cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Kuntzelman

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough
customer_reviews.text: The cherries I bought, which I thought were your average grocery store cherries, were too big for this. The long metal part doesn’t push all the way through and often the pit is too big to get through the hole. I removed the plastic part to clean and then it wouldn’t stay back on and kept falling off. I’m trying to sell it for five dollars without it because I ended up losing it. Ended up buying another one from Amazon that was way better.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Chamberland

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it said that it could work with olives but the space available for introducing the olives is TOO small for the premium ones. Useless for me now...
customer_reviews.author: Armando Cavero

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This is tedious to use and essentially does not work. The cherry seed gets stuck in the hole, actually jammed in there, and you have to use a screwdriver or some other implement to push it out. Removing the seeds from of a bowl of cherries could turn into an all night project. Good in concept, falls well short in function.
customer_reviews.author: pupsik

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing. But barely.
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it worked well. Since then, though, we've used it maybe six times and it pits about half the cherries. Unfortunately, it makes a hole all the way through so you THINK the pit is gone. After biting into two pits we now pit the cherry then rip it in half just to make sure the pit is gone. Half the time it's still inside. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Works for what it is intended for
customer_reviews.text: This would work fine for cherries and smaller olives. I tried it with large olives. It takes 2 hands and is hard to get the angle of the pit right to push it through the hole. (And some of the pits are to large and get stuck in the hole). The little push rod bends and has to be readjusted. So i would not recommend this for larger olives.
customer_reviews.author: Russell W. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite !!
customer_reviews.text: I love adding fresh cherries to fruit salads but getting the pits out of the cherries can be very time consuming. I started using a paring knife, which took forever. Since then I have gone through 5 different cherry pitters. None of them worked for very long or worked very well. I WAS THRILLED TO FIND THIS CHERRY PITTER ON AMAZON. It works so well and is capable of pitting all different sizes plus it is sturdy and made of stainless steel with a clear plastic guard.
customer_reviews.author: PAM from PD

customer_reviews.title: Will not pit olives!
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT pit olives. Will pit cherries, if they're not too big. Surprising to me, since OXO usually makes quality products, that work well. I tried to pit some green olives and even when I pressed as hard as I could, it wouldn't work. Olives hold on to their seeds much tighter than cherries, so it would probably work for small cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: This thing is freaking awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! It's high quality and sturdy, and will not break easily! It doesn't tear the cherry apart, either, which is cool. It only punches out a trap door in the bottom of the cherry, pushing the pit out, but not wasting a big piece of the fruit. The juice doesn't splash everywhere, either. I wish I would've bought one of these years ago. I just used it for 12 pounds of cherries for jam, and it took me 20 minutes to prep all 12 pounds. It took me half a day with a bobby pin to pit half this amount last summer. I love this thing!
customer_reviews.author: TraceyG

customer_reviews.title: not worth the squeeze
customer_reviews.text: The pits get stuck if they are over a certain size and the handle pinches sometimes. I eat cherries out of hand and prefer to just use my mouth, but my 5 and 8 year olds haven't learned the technique yet to de-pit with their teeth. This thing is a pain as in our last bag of cherries about one in eight pits got stuck and then its tough to unblock the mechanism. Ugh, sad it didn't work better. Also, the handle pinches my hand sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: David Coon

customer_reviews.title: Love this product - concept to execution excellent
customer_reviews.text: Tired of cutting cherry pits? Me too. This product changed my life (well, in a limited scope). It’s incredibly sturdy and efficient. I pitted half a package of cherries for my two kids in probably under a minute. No more trying to cut around and pry the pits out for me! I just love this product more than someone realistically should.
customer_reviews.author: lauren Ashley Klein

customer_reviews.title: wish I'd had this years ago
customer_reviews.text: Man, does this make pitting cherries SO MUCH EASIER. Getting the dang thing together initially was the hardest part; I was having trouble figuring out how to get that clear acrylic bit attached. Also, you do have to watch for the occasional pit that gets through. Now pitting a bag of cherries takes 15 minutes instead of an hour and you don't look quite so much like you murdered someone by the end.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Gawe

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I finally made it! I got me the best cherry pitter in existence! I am now the envy of the neighborhood men all huddled and frightened by my massive culinary shadow darkening their previous blue skies of baking bliss! The perfectly precious pitter presents pitiful prayers pointed heavenward for guidance like the little ship lost on the sea of galallee.
customer_reviews.author: Amazin is evil

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Ive used many cherry pitters in the past from the rotary cast, gravity feed popper (Not bad), homemade hand held pen, But this one is so far the best if you have time to sit down and pit away. 10 lbs. of cherries in about 35 minutes. Easy on the hands if you take a break occasionally. Dont even have to de-stem. Grab the cherry by the stem, insert, POP, and while still holding down, yank the stem, release...walla.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for pitting cherries
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing to make fresh cherry pies to canned cherries to make cherry jam. It saves your hands from being very discolored and it’s very good at getting out the pits. I still went back and checked and I think I found three in one pie prior to baking so still be on the alert. There’s nothing like biting into a hard cherry pit
customer_reviews.author: Melody Callan

customer_reviews.title: Darn Impressive
customer_reviews.text: This thing just does what it is described as doing. It works flawlessly. It has a wonderful design as so many OXO products do, and it takes a cherry pit out easily and leaves you with the perfect cherry. We used to have one that would just about shred the cherry and you'd be looking at a pile of wasted cherry juice as well. This one does a clean job of it, and you have very little work involved. Cleans up easily and folds in a way that makes it as small as possible for your drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill F.

customer_reviews.title: A must for any cherry and olive eater!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cherry pitter, I used to put with a knife all by hand and I was done with that mess. This may be a one-use tool, but if you regularly eat olives and cherries it’s worth it! The splash guard is really smart although it won’t eliminate all splash and sometimes puts get stuck but they are then easy to remove by hand. It’s very comfortable to use and has been easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell L. Gillman

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality But
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and good quality, Also easy to clean. However, the plug is a bit small. I pitted most cherries without a problem but there were quit a few cherries where the pit moved to the side and never came out of the cherries. I had to pluck them out with a paperclip.
customer_reviews.author: EF

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer!
customer_reviews.text: O-M-G! This gadget changed my morning parfait routine! I always look forward to June because it's the start of cherry season...I probably eat 30lbs during this short season. I really wanted to have them in my 'overnight oatmeal, fruit and yogurt" breakfast parfaits, but who wants to spit out pits while eating breakfast, right?! This is so easy to use and works just like shown in the video. I was tempted to the less expensive one, but I'm glad I settled on OXO because it stays comfortable in my had after pitting 4 pounds of cherries. Now i'am thinking of making cherry preserves and cherry tarts...Yay!
customer_reviews.author: The Charley Factor

customer_reviews.title: Item used/returned
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see that this item had been used/returned. The plastic zip-ties holding the pitter to the packaging had been cut. The vendor kept them in the packaging...cut. Very disappointed!!! I would have returned it if I didn't need it for a recipe. On second thought, maybe I should return it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Horton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and wash.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a few cherries before you can get a hold of how to use it. Some of my friends recommended this pitter but only after I got it myself, I understand how useful it is. I use a lot of fresh cherries to make desserts and definitely recommend this.. Easy to wash and use. Great pitter
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Swati Verma

customer_reviews.title: Not for larger cherries...
customer_reviews.text: Too small. I couldn’t even get the cherries into the unit. The ones I could, it missed the pit.
customer_reviews.author: Cooking Heaven

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t sure if it would be worth the trouble of getting a cherry putter, but now that I have it, I’m very glad I did. It’s very easy to use and just takes a second to pit a cherry. It takes very little pressure. It’s very easy to clean. There are just no downsides.
customer_reviews.author: atslk

customer_reviews.title: Stop letting cherries rot because they are too much work!
customer_reviews.text: This gadget is great! When I first saw it on Amazon, I thought it was a little pricey for such a small item with such limited use. I also kept letting my cherries rot because they were too much work to eat. This was stupid! Cherries are expensive (this item cost about as much as 2 lbs. of cherries)! I decided to buy this item and stop wasting my cherries! So glad I did. I can now quickly and cleanly pit many cherries. Yummy and healthful! FWIW, this thing reminds me of a piercing gun - lol (in case you wondered about the mechanism)!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cherry snacks
customer_reviews.text: I hate the whole idea of putting a cherry in my mouth and trying to spit out the pit, it's disgusting. This thing goes throgh the cherries very quickly. I could pit a whole snack Bowl of Cherries in under a minute! I really don't understand the complaints where maybe a little tiny bit is stuck to the pit, it would be much more if you tried to use a knife or your teeth! It does take a bit of hand strength, so it's not good for kids to use. I love this silly thing, Oxo did it again!
customer_reviews.author: Drumlin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific idea. I was able to de-pit a whole bag of cherries in half the time. Be sure the top of the cherry is lined up with the plunger. It will de-pit the fruit if it ISN'T, but the fruit will look better if it is. It is easy to clean as it comes apart totally, and very easy to handle. I have arthritis in my hands and I had no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: great for pitting!
customer_reviews.text: Whoever said to use a beer bottle and chopstick to pit cherries was a dreamer, it sucked and didn't work well at all. After pitting a pound of cherries with a knife, my fingers, and the previously referenced stupid idea, I bought this. It pitted 98% of the cherries without problem, only 1 or 2 pits sneaked through. It made making pies and tarts much easier and faster, the cherries were done in no time at all. Splatter is a minimum. Easy to clean. Dishwasher safe. I don't generally get one use kitchen products (ok, two if you use this for olives) but this is totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Reb

customer_reviews.title: Kinda the pits!
customer_reviews.text: I love most OXO products, but this is a definite miss. It doesn't work so great, missing many cherry pits so you have to remove them manually. I pitted 3 lbs and about a 30% of the pits got stuck in the plastic extruder and I had to poke them out with a chopstick! I do not recommend this cherry pitter. I'm going to try a different brand. What a letdown!
customer_reviews.author: Bogusnot

customer_reviews.title: Great for making cherry pies
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than manually pitting cherries! Works well 98% of the time. You have to be careful though, because sometimes it feels like it pushed the pit out but it only pushed the pit to one side. So after pitting the cherries, be sure to check them all to be sure the pit is actually out. Your teeth will thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great, and not as messy as others
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cherry pitter. I had one like it except that it didn’t have the clear plastic “spray guard,” or whatever you call it. It worked, but made a mess with the cherry juice splatter. This one eliminates that mess, and I love it! It’s easy to use and seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ASTERrisk

customer_reviews.title: so easy
customer_reviews.text: i know $10 is a lot of money to spend on piting cherries, but OMG, this is so worth it when you have kids. Punch and go, punch and go. So incredibly easy to use and clean. It’s heavy and sturdy and makes quick work with little waste. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fun and effective gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I was making my first cherry pie for thanksgiving so I purchased this. I love it! It gets the pits out like it was supposed to do. Problem the cherries I got were not so great so if on the softer size pits not pop out as easily. I definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Annax

customer_reviews.title: Not too big, Not too small....just right (the olive)
customer_reviews.text: So this item should be good, in theory, but the problem is: 1) if the olive to big, the pit won't go through the hole. 2) If the olive is too small, it goes entirely through the hole. So the olive has to be JUST the right size
customer_reviews.author: Avi

customer_reviews.title: Got kids? Get this.
customer_reviews.text: My kids love cherries, but dealing with the pit is always time consuming and annoying. Got this. It's amazing! Still takes time, but way better than slicing it up. I've noticed you do have to hit it and angle the cherry just right, otherwise, it splits the side of the cherry open. But who cares, besides picky kids...
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: a good one.
customer_reviews.text: Lisa has several recipes that call for 30-40 olives. This little thing is a whiz. Some people can use a knife to pit an olive. I can sort of do it with a knife in about 3 times as long. I've had it for 3 years and it still going strong several hundred olives later. Love this thing. Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not the best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: Very slow and laborious - one needs to line up the cherry with the pitter, and 9 times out of 10 the pit does not get fully expelled, entailing removing it by hand. Can't imagine why Amazon rates this one top of the line.
customer_reviews.author: Martin P. Maley

customer_reviews.title: Now I get cherries every week!
customer_reviews.text: This cherry pitter lives up to every expectation I had. Are used to avoid buying cherries because they were such a pain, but now I get them every week. It is easy to use, easy to clean, and a wonderful deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki K. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t decide if I needed this gadget or not. HUGE cherry fan, and biting the pit out has never been THAT much of an issue. With two toddlers now in the house who also love cherries, the pit became a bigger problem. Finally decided to just go ahead and purchase. It’s so awesome! Almost magic-like. The only “problem” now is that it’s really sped up the speed with how fast I can eat through a bag of cherries. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 years old granddaughter who kept eating the cherry pits. Works great and she can actually operate it herself. Now I just have to get her to do it over the garbage can so the pup will quit eating the pits.
customer_reviews.author: Maltese Mom

customer_reviews.title: If you're think about it, the answer is yes
customer_reviews.text: If you've got enough cherries or olives that you're thinking about whether or not you need this, then the answer is yes you do. My wife and I pitted a large box of sour cherries last summer to make jam, pie filling, boozy cherries, and sugar pack frozen cherries. It would have been an impossible task without this. Good grips, easy to use, easy to clean. Made a tedious task much more bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Dodgson_here

customer_reviews.title: More Cherry Pies To Come
customer_reviews.text: I love this pitter! As delicious as cherries are they were too troublesome before I got this pitter. I’m excited about experimenting w/cherries in a variety of dishes now. PS, I appreciate the little shield that protects me fr/cherry splatter too.
customer_reviews.author: Ido1der

customer_reviews.title: It works well and lasts for years!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cherry pitter. It's quick and easy to use. You don't need to be slow or careful about how you load the fruit in - it's a breeze to get through a quart of cherries. I like it enough that I've given it as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: another great OXO product
customer_reviews.text: another great OXO product! my 2 year old loves cherries but obviously doesn't understand that she needs to spit out the pit so i would spend forever just cutting cherries in half to dig out the pit for her and she could eat them as fast as i could prepare them. this thing makes that job soooo much easier. plus it is so easy to clean which is a huge bonus
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: The splatter guard is good, but can be a pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for de-pitting olives that I pick, cure and marinate each year. I used this tool for the first time on my first batch of olives just last night. I found that the pitter works well for large olives - the small ones slip right through. The splatter guard is good, but can be a pain to clean. I'll continue to use and maybe hone my skills to improve the usage.
customer_reviews.author: CoastalCohort

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool but don’t dishwasher the plastic
customer_reviews.text: Essential for parents of toddlers who like cherries! So much easier than cutting outs out. Only 3 starts on the cleaning side because the plastic splash guard got distorted from the dishwasher top rack and can no longer be attached.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Good cherry pitter!
customer_reviews.text: I like the heft of this pitter--definitely better than all plastic. It's easy to squeeze and makes cherry pitting a much simpler task. And the fact that it locks closed makes for easy storage in my small kitchen. Like most OXO products, I expect this to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Blonde

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Gets almost all pits. Some are too big and won't push through but only occasionally. A big time saver. Not sure it's very durable but if it lasts a year, it'll be worth it. Overall am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Pits get stuck
customer_reviews.text: The hole is too small and nearly every pit gets stuck. It adds the extra step of forcing the pit back up the hole and staining your fingers red. This is supposed to keep the cherry juice off your hands.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product I've ever purchased. I'm such a cheapskate that I've tried practically all the kitchen hacks there are for cherry pitting. I used the paper clip method but that wastes a lot of the fruit. So I decided to try a cherry pitter and I absolutely LOVE it! I would recommend this product to everyone. The splash shield will keep the cherry juice from exploding all over your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Kalena

customer_reviews.title: Great Pitter
customer_reviews.text: The splash guard is a must, it definitely minimizes the splatters but even with the splash guard It doesn’t fully stop the cherry juices from splattering. It does great getting the seeds out.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Appreciate the small size
customer_reviews.text: My other cherry pitter became outdated when stores started selling bigger cherries -- they no longer fit down the chute. The silver lining in having to buy another pitter is that this handheld style stores in a drawer, taking up less space.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Gret little cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: Great little gadget! My husband actually operated it,but we pitted several hundred cherries to make bourbon soaked cherries & the pitter did not let us down! His arm was a little tight for a day or do, but to be expected after that process! I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J Truttschel

customer_reviews.title: Not all pits get spit out!
customer_reviews.text: I was using this to pit Bing cherries. Because of the shape of the pit, it will sometimes get stuck. I found that if I put the cherry in stem-side up (where the stem used to be), the pit will clear. I had too many cherries to spend time messing around with this and bought a different one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and mostly does the job
customer_reviews.text: This seemed very sturdy and it mostly did the job. There were a few pits that remained in the cherries. Got to watch out for those, especially if you freeze them, like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Summers

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I like this cherry pitter. I remember using a large plunge type of pitter with my mom when I was little, but I couldn’t seem to find a decent one of those. I didn’t realize when I bought it, but it folds for storage, which is a nice feature. It works pretty good. I did have to watch & make sure a pit came out, because there were several that the pit didn’t come out (maybe one out of eight). I like the splash guard thing, though it still does get a little cherry juice spray/splatter every now and again. It worked on my large cherries & also some small cherries I had. Overall, I like the pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn B

customer_reviews.title: OXO cherry and Olive pitter is a must have item
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Pitter for years. I often give it as a hostess gift. My nephew and his wife thought it was so great they went out and bought more cherries to pit. A must have item and OXO's is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: BCC

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory to remove pits from cherries and olives.
customer_reviews.text: I was canning brandies cherries and needed a way to take the pits out. This looked like wonderful option. I’m glad I did. I was able to quickly take the pits out of 5 lbs of cherries. It was simple to use and I could see if the Stone was out through the little window. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sweetcharlee

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Positives - Good quality build - Extremely easy to use - Good price for the amount of time it saves Negatives Honestly, I couldn’t find anything great product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Defrain

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to make cherry pie during cherry season. I was able to do several pounds of cherries in only 20 min. This cherry pitter makes it a breeze. I did have a slight issue with some pits not coming out of the cherries but I think that could happen with any device like this and it happens at factories too why you may find an occasional pit in a can of cherries. So, aside from the occasional pit to worry about the entire process was quick and easy to remove pits from hundreds of cherries. It's made well. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Another great product from OXO
customer_reviews.text: It is bing cherry season. I wanted to be able to freeze them. This product worked great. Now I came enjoy in my smoothie everyday. Thanks OXO for another great product.
customer_reviews.author: susan reed

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Had an excess of cherries in the fridge this year, with the pitter I was able to quickly pit dozens of cherries for different uses. I'm a big fan of OXO products, this one included, it's easy to use, easy to clean, it works really really well.
customer_reviews.author: azjmw

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love OXO products! I have a cherry tree in my yard and made cherry cobbler the other night and this pitter was super helpful and made the whole process that much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki J

customer_reviews.title: Pit gets stuck in the bottom part
customer_reviews.text: A while ago I bought one of these gadgets (off-brand) at the grocery store and loved it! Unfortunately I twisted it the wrong way one day and it broke, so I bought this as my replacement. This works, but the pit does not fall out the bottom as easily, I would say for 2 lbs of cherries, I had to maneuver the pit out half of the time.
customer_reviews.author: M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: After years of my old fashioned wire version cherry pitter, this one is lovely. I've had it for a year now and am very happy with it, like every other OXO designed product I own. No more sore hands like my old cherry pitter. I have not tried it on olives.
customer_reviews.author: Question The Norm

customer_reviews.title: Gadget Worth Having
customer_reviews.text: This just the greatest little gadget!! The cherry season has been spectacular this year and we wanted to freeze some for later use. The spray guard was a little lame, considering the unusually large size of the cherries, but it did a great pitting the fruit.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Taylert

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Cherry and Olive Pitter, Red
product_meta.description:
Color:Red| Style Name:PitterSplatter shield protects work area from juices and removes for cleaning. Sturdy, die-cast zinc construction removes pits with ease. Generous holder accommodates large cherries like bing and rainier, and is recessed to secure smaller varieties of cherries and olives.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Splatter Shield protects work area from juices and removes for cleaning
Sturdy, die cast zinc construction removes pits with ease
Soft, comfortable non slip handles absorb pressure
Generous holder accommodates large cherries like Bing and Rainier, and is recessed to secure smaller varieties of cherries and olives

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,306 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
